quizzes.title: History Quiz: Bulgaria and Portugal
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, john, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the title of the Bulgarian national anthem, adopted in 1964?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dear Motherland

questions.question: What type of governmental does Portugal have?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Democratic republic

questions.question: What notable Portuguese novelist and playwright was honored with the 1998 Nobel Prize for literature?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jose Saramago

questions.question: What rare bird species is endemic to the Portuguese island of Madeira?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Bulgaria is one of the worlds biggest producers of this agricultural crop.
What are the two basic colors on the national flag of Portugal?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Green and red

questions.question: What city is the capital and largest city in Bulgaria, as well as the 12th largest city by population in the European Union?
What is the capital and largest city of Portugal?
What is the name of the European peninsula on which Portugals mainland is located?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Iberian Peninsula

questions.question: The Balkan Peninsula was named after this natural object located in the center of Bulgaria.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Balkan Mountains

questions.question: What is the most popular sport in Bulgaria, with world-known representatives such as Dimitar Berbatov and Hristo Stoichkov?
What type of meat is used for the preparation of the traditional Portuguese stew called Caldeirada?
Which of these was invented by the Bulgarian-American scientist John Vincent Atanasoff?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The first electronic digital computer

questions.question: In the early medieval rock relief Madara Rider, found in northeastern Bulgaria, what animal is lying at a horses feet while the rider is killing it with his spear?
What is the official language of Portugal?

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Symbol and Bird
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, title, brazil. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This marsupial endemic to Australia is the countrys national animal and symbol.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sigmund Freud

questions.question: What mythical animal is one of the symbols of the United Kingdom?

What bird is the national symbol of France?
What mammal is the national animal and symbol of Russia?
What large colorful bird is the national bird of India?
What is the official state religion adopted by the government of Portugal?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: Edward  Bernays and this man are considered to be the fathers of modern day public relations.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ivy Lee

questions.question: What parrot is one of the national animals of Brazil?
What is the title of the national anthem of Portugal?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: What large rodent is a national animal and symbol of Canada?
What large animal is the national symbol of Spain?
Many of the first PR practitioners, such as  Edward Bernays and John W. Hill, got their start in this institution.

options.text: The United States Environmental Protection Agency

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Committee on Public Information

questions.question: The Green Pheasant is the national bird of this Asian country.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: City and Italy
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, agrigento, election. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which city is known as the city of Romeo and Juliet?
In the election of 1828, this president crushed his opponent, with the help of the political strategist and publicist Amos Kendall.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Andrew Jackson

questions.question: Paestum was a Greek colony, originally known as Poseidonia.
Throughout his career, Ivy Lee, one of the early PR practitioners, worked for many important historical figures. Which of these is not among them?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Henry Ford

questions.question: In the famous Torches of Freedom Contingent campaign launched by Edward Bernays, what were the female models holding in their hands?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: lit cigarettes

questions.question: In 1993, this large beverage production company, successfully mounted a massive PR campaign to restore customers confidence, after a syringe was found in a can of their products.
The Sacra di San Michele, also known as Saint Michael’s Abbey, is located on Mount Pirchiriano.
What statement is true about Castel del Monte, which is situated in the Apulia region of Italy?

options.text: This was the castle of Frederick II.
The fortress of the castle is an octagonal prism.
The castle depicted on the reverse side of the Italian cent

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: This public relations campaign was aimed at earning the trust of the Iraqi people during the war with America.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hearts and Minds

questions.question: The worlds first botanical garden was established in 1545 in this Italian city.
Florence is located in the Italian region of Tuscany.
This pejorative term is used to describe some PR practitioners and press agents.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Spin Doctors

questions.question: Which of these temples is located in Agrigento, Italy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Mount Vesuvius eruption in AD 79 led to the burying and destruction of the Roman cities of Pompeii and Herculaneum.
This early publicist is also famous for his circus empire.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: P.T. Barnum

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: City and Journalism
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, colosseum, navel. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Joseph Pulitzer and William Randolph Hearst are often blamed for drawing the US into the Spanish-American War.
What time period is known as the Golden Age of US print media?
Which resort town located near Rio de Janeiro is called The Saint Tropez of Brazil?
Who said the following:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William Randolph Hearst

questions.question: Who began his career in newspapers by taking over management of a San Francisco newspaper from his father?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William Randolph Hearst

questions.question: Yogyakarta used to be the capital of Indonesia.
What is the meaning of yellow journalism?

options.text: reluctance by news media professionals to cover politically scandalous events for fear of negative backlash
scandal-mongering, sensationalism, jingoism or other unethical or unprofessional practices by news media professionals
overly optimistic coverage of major news stories in order to abate public fear or panic

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: scandal-mongering, sensationalism, jingoism or other unethical or unprofessional practices by news media professionals

questions.question: The name of this city means “Shelter under the tree”.
This city is located on the Baja California peninsula in Mexico.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cabo San Lucas

questions.question: Whose life story was a source of inspiration for the lead character in Orson Welles classic film, Citizen Kane?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William Randolph Hearsts

questions.question: Who helped to establish the Missouri School of Journalism and the Columbia University Graduate School of Journalism, two of the most prestigious journalism schools in the US?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joseph Pulitzer

questions.question: In the 1992 Disney film musical Newsies Robert Duvall played a fictionalized version of which Golden Age newspaper publisher?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joseph Pulitzer

questions.question: This Polynesian island, also called Navel of the World, was dicovered by Dutch explorer Jacob Roggeveen.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Easter Island

questions.question: Galileo Galilei is said to have dropped two cannon balls from the Leaning Tower of Pisa.
In the 2000 film Gladiator, the Colosseum was re-created via computer-generated imagery.

quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, john. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What late night television host was born in Corning, Iowa?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Johnny Carson

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Buffalo Bill Cody

options.text: All of these methods can be used.

The Valley of the Kings is located in Egypt.
The capital of Iowa, Des Moines, was named after an Indian chief.

The life story of this man began in the central Iowa town of Winterset. He was born Marion Robert Morrison, the son of Clyde and Mary Brown Morrison. He went on to become a well-known actor who appeared in many western and war movies.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Wayne

questions.question: Advice columnists Ann Landers and Abigail Van Buren were twin sisters.

options.text: Low capital costs, higher operational and maintenance costs
High capital costs, lower operational and maintenance costs

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Honduras and Countries
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, sight, independence. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What was PLUTO?

options.text: A project in which trials were performed only one week after the first meeting
A project designed to lay pipeline across the English Channel

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All three answers are correct.

questions.question: Which one of these countries does not border Honduras?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Costa Rica

questions.question: Honduras is one of the 10 richest countries in the Western Hemisphere.
What is the most common and popular sport in Honduras?
Most marine pipelines are laid by the pontoon method of floating the pipe at the sea surface before lowering it to the ocean floor.
What was the estimated rate of release of carbon dioxide, worldwide in the 1990s?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 6 billion tonnes per year

questions.question: What year defines the break-through in offshore drilling out of sight of land?
Following what attack did Honduras join the allied nations?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pearl Harbor

questions.question: What is the national mammal of Honduras?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: White Tailed Deer

questions.question: What is the maximum depth that divers can reach to work on marine pipelines?
Which of the following was a key factor in the Spanish conquest of Honduras?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Silver Mining

questions.question: What factor has prevented the construction of a gas pipeline from Nigeria to Europe?

options.text: It cannot be transported that far.
The difficulty of terrain and water crossings
Funding for this endeavor is not yet achievable.
Vulnerability to terrorism and political interference

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vulnerability to terrorism and political interference

questions.question: In 1969 Honduras and El Salvador fought in what became known as what war?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Soccer War

questions.question: What year did Spain grant independence to Honduras?
What is the national bird of Honduras?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Scarlet Macaw
